reviews.text:
the wait time was around 30 min on a wednesday night (around 8:30pm) and was pretty busy. we got a text that our table was ready and the waitress was very nice.

the food was Outstanding ,excellent service and incredibly delicious dessert!

We started with the delicious variety of breads and the mouthwatering egg rolls, next we enjoyed the chicken samosas sliders along with the shrimp pasta. Both items were incredibly tasty and cooked to perfection. For dessert we enjoyed the cheesecake. What an outstanding experience!!!  Definitely worth the wait…  Will definitely visit again!!!

Visited Galleria Mall in Tysons with relatives and decided to stop in Cheesecake factory for lunch.

Huge inside and as we were early (was packed when we left) was shown to a table so we could see the sunny outside.

Chris R was our host and attentive and of course helped by other servers.

The chicken samosas are always excellent and we also ordered dynamite shrimp for appetizers.

For main course we had the Club; skinny shrimp tacos and fried shrimp platter. All very good and large servings. For drinks the tropical ginger cooler and decaf coffees with tea. Dessert a huge slice of carrot cake.

A great lunch and will definitely go back. This location is much more open with light than the one in Arlington.

A great Cheesecake Factory in the area. We've tried a few and always come back to this one. It's clean and while busy we've never had trouble getting a seat. Portions are good and food is consistent. I ordered the cauliflower tacos for the first time on the server's recommendation and was not disappointed. Yum!

Cheesecake slices were also very generous which I've found is a bit hit or miss these days.

My friend wanted to come here ... I Saud, you just want the cheesecake" and using lunch as an excuse. He admitted and laugh 🙄🤣🤣. He got the Salmon with mashed potato and asparagus,  and I had it before and it was delicious!! I ordered the Jamaican Black Pepper Spicy Shrimp with plantains, black beans and pineapple and rice. The shrimp was so spicy, for me, and everything was delicious including the black bean. I ate almost everything 😋.  Then Dessert time!! My friend ordered the chocolate one, and I got coconut cream cheesecake.  Mine was so good. Mostly lighter in flavor which I prefer versus the chocolate often is more rich in flavor.  The bottom thin layer is  Chewy coconut and a little sweeter... so good!! I couldn't finish the cheesecake. It will be finished tomorrow.  😋 I will be sure to rub it in tomorrow and send my friend who ate his entire slice of his cheesecake.  😋🤣🥰

Got the Steak and chicken as it was quite nice. Made reservations and was instantly seated.

The main course was delicious but the bread did come out cold and the Old Fashion they made wasn’t that great. Just tasted like whiskey and couldn’t taste the bitters.

Overall very good and quick service, especially on Christmas Eve

Update:  came here for dinner last night.  Apparently,  the menu has been updated and I ordered the same thing I had last time...spinach and chicken manicotti.  This was one of the update dishes and I must say it was not a good update.  This dish was smaller and quite salty.   It just didn't taste as good sadly.  I will not order it again and I included a pic of the new one so you can see the difference in the original dish (red and white dish) and the new one I ordered last night.

Excellent food!  Had dinner here and can't wait to return.  Staff were courteous,  the restaurant was clean and the food delicious!  There is a wide variety on the menu to choose from and prices are quite reasonable considering options and portion sizes.  Sadly, we were so full we couldn't order dessert but there were some great options none the less.  Highly recommend!

My visit was a late lunch/early dinner. Everything tasted great and we were happy with everything we ate there. Our food was:

Zucchini fritter (great breading and seasoning with scrumptious crunch in every bite, don't skip on the dipping sauce as it elevates the taste)

Stuffed mushrooms (smooth buttery mushrooms with lemon sauce makes the dish sublime)

Spaghetti and meatball (great delicious perfection of tender moist meatball with saucy spaghetti)

Chef's KB's Lobster carbonara (sweet pieces of lobster with snap peas in truffle cream sauce and perfectly cooked pasta. We removed the bacon)

Beef tenderloin medallions (I was extremely happy with the cook as I asked for medium and it was perfectly cooked. I would recommend going down one level of cooking to get your desired cook. The sauce was luscious and the mashed potatoes and onions were perfect sides. I requested no mushrooms and it was put in a separate dish which I appreciated)

Our server (Ric) was beyond excellent as he took great care of our food and service. He was attentive and went on his way to help us get the ultimate complete meal.

I removed one star because the Maggiano's should have milk alternatives. We didn't get to have coffee because they didn't have almond or soy milk. They should adjust that as people can have food restrictions. I hope next time we come, they will have other milk options so we can enjoy coffee after dinner.

I ordered catering from Maggiano’s for a business event. I expect for it to be the normal fast and go service, however, the representative went above and beyond to ensure everything was setup professionally.  Her attention to detail was phenomenal, and she was very friendly.  Her name is Marta, she is the coordinator of the events and I highly recommend her if you need great service. We were impressed and happy with the service and the food was delicious. Here are some pictures of the event.

OMG😋The food was so delicious! We ordered The Famous Rigatoni "D" only mistake we asked for no mushrooms and still gave us mushrooms, but it was okay they were big enough to remove in whole!! We did takeout but it's definitely a nice atmosphere and we will be back to dine in to get the full experience!!

Maggiano was really cute and lovely place, nice for party and dates.
I had chicken piccata for lunch and i love the lemon taste and everything about my dish.
and our waitress was really nice and brought us this sweets which was so nice of him.
I Definitely Suggest Maghiano’s Little Italy😊

It was our first experience of Kaitenzushi dining and it was pleasant. I can ignore the seating was so close that you literally bumped into the person sitting besides you. We weren’t really hungry but ended up eating spider roll, blue crab roll and salmon&avocado roll and also ordered poke bowl. Prices are quite reasonable and everything we had was good.

i Absolutely adore the concept of this place.
The conveyor belt interactive concept where you just sit down, and grab a plate from the moving belt, and prices are depending to the color of the plate chosen. Plates range anywhere from around $3.50-$8 I believe.

You can get a decent roll consisting of about 4 to 5 pieces for $5. Oh, I should add that the rolls are not full rolls most of the quality ones have 5 pieces tops. But there are some other rolls with about 6 to 8 pieces too, I got the Tyson's & Dragon roll this visit, i loved the dragon roll, the presentation is cute & the eel was yummy.

This particular visit I didn't think my cup was too clean but in good faith it could've been stained from previous orders (as it seems like their designated cup for green tea)

Do not expect a Japanese steakhouse type of sushi quality, or even too much of the best mom and pop (small) sushi restaurants that you've been to. The big thing about this place is more so the experience of it all and how cool the conveyor belt is.

But with that being said ...I have always enjoyed sushi here every time I visited wasabi.
2.5 stars but the experience makes it a solid 3.

This was a fun experience in eating sushi. You basically grab a plate as it motors by on the conveyor. Different color plates have different prices. It was a good way to enjoy different kinds of sushi and it all tasted good. The service and presentation are a bit lacking, however, when you get used to the concept it can be an easy fun way to fill up.

Nice experience
The staff are friendly in spite of they are super busy
We went for the experience and the style of the service
My son is a huge fan of sushi
The prices highlighted based on the colour in the menu
There is like 5 colours dishes
I can’t say about the quality of food more than normal ! Nothing spectacular ! The experience all about the rounding dishes/ plates thing !
Very busy in the weekend
For such prices, you can easily find a better Sushi quality and quantity.
In overall, it’s was nice experience

Amazing sushi restaurant with a revolving train. Great selection of sushi, wait staff was delightful, and everything tasted delicious. Only complaint is the fact that it's in the middle of the mall, directly under an escalator.

P F Chang is a place with a fantastic ambiance and customer service.

I happened to be there with friends for lunch. The server was amiable and professional and gave us some fantastic suggestions. I enjoyed the Egg drop soup and Seasame chicken.

It's a place worth dining in when you don't want to go wrong.

There is no doubt that the food at this restaurant looks and tastes amazing. The overall ambiance is excellent.

BUT, the BIGGEST ISSUE IS THAT THE FOOD TERRIBLY OILY!!! Everything that you order is dripping with oil and you will easily see that on your plates which are black in color and show you easily how oily your food is lol!

Not really great for your health if you have cholesterol issues.

Very kind and warm servers, makes for a comfortable environment. Was just disappointed with the food. They do have a couple items marked gluten free (you have to look up the menu yourself now) on the menu, but I wouldn’t suggest the Singapore noodles. I’ve had this dish multiple times elsewhere and was disappointed in the quality, taste and presentation of it. Perhaps the non gluten free version is better balanced?

Lovely experience at this location. The wait was short during the time we went for lunch, but once seated we were serviced by our waiters fairly quickly. The atmosphere of the place was subtle and quiet even for the amount of people inside. Tried the special holiday drink, delicious very much recommend if they're doing it during the Christmas season. The Sesame Chicken was excellent.

Very good. So sad they closed the local one but this meal was good. We had Chicken Lettuce wraps, Mongolian beef, crispy chicken, short ribs over pineapple fried rice and for dessert fried Bananas with ice cream.
It is one my favorite milkshake/icecream. Here service is quick even though it's small and congested. My favorites are Belgium chocolate milkshake and Dulce deluche ice cream. Jsut deliciousssssss
They got so many variety of ice creams and shakes! I got the Irish ice cream and it was amazing! The portions are super big!
Tasty ice cream! The staff could be nicer to customers. I asked for extra caramel, I was told I already have extra caramel so I said OK, thank you.
I always love going to this ice cream place! The ice creams are the best. Top one

Unfortunately, not a great experience. While location only had 1 family ahead of us and 2 clerks behind the counter, clerk didn't listen to our order, got it very wrong, then got annoyed when corrected. Follow up order was so skimpy it was absolutely NOT worth the $5.99 for the ice cream nor the stale (inedible) waffle cone bowl that added $2.09 to the order. And we ordered 3 of the same order that were all the same---3 kids all walking out asking why they got half a scoop and Mom wondering why she just paid $25.69 for THAT????  Never doing THAT again!

Ambiance is nice and the place is clean. There’s a space for parking. The food is great and it’s good that they provides salad and bread for every table. Nice and friendly servers. Wine price isn’t bad. It’s closer to Tysons corner, you can dine in after a long walk from shopping.

Dec 2021
Delicious food, good service. It's been several years since I went to an Olive Garden, but the food quality seems the same. Definitely less crowded than I remember. The tables have been spaced out more, but they take care to seat every other table. Most, but not all, of the staff wear masks. Looks like they still offer coloring papers for kids. The menu is much smaller, though they have added a never-ending soup and salad option, which is considered a meal in itself. Be aware that not all of their drink options may be available.

The most interesting change is the addition of a (heavy) mobile tablet to each table. The tablet has an appetizer, shortened drink, dessert, and kids menu. They have limited games available on the tablet too. Note that the tablet is used to order appetizers, which is what our server did for us. The tablet is also used to pay with card, and it has a slot in the back where you can insert your chip card. It also allows tap paying in the front. For the tip, it offers a sliding scale on screen so you can choose the percentage or amount of tip you want to leave. And finally, you can print out the receipt from the front of the tablet. Truly fascinating.

Service was pretty good, though a bit slower at the end. Our server seemed a bit awkward/new, but was very friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodating. She was quick to offer us more portions of bread, salad, and refillable drinks without being asked. She also quickly removed empty plates for us.

One of us ordered coffee, and I was interested to see they gave us a small pot of coffee, bowl of sugar, and tiny pitcher of cream. And mug of course. Sadly forgot to take a picture. It would have been more sophisticated if the set came on a tray, but this is not that type of restaurant. 😜

All of the food was very good. I was a bit so-so in realizing that practically all of their appetizers are fried, but they were all very delicious. The Spinach-Artichoke Dip was very good. Maybe a little too salty, but plenty of spinach. The breadsticks still come already salted and oiled.

Note the entrees come with soup or salad (it doesn't say this on the menu, but it's true). The server still offers additional cheese with the salad and entrees. Both the Chicken Marsala and the Chicken Parmigiana were tender and moist. All the pastas perfectly cooked and the sauces delicious. I think the portion sizes have decreased a little, but that's sort of expected.

All in all, good food and good service. May come again.
There is no way you can finish your plate. I love their soups that comes with the entire. Delicious food with affordable price! Nice location and easy parking.

Love fresh Shrimp Scampi and Chicken Marsala! We tried Calamari for appetizer, taste good! The chicken is tender and served with spagheti alfredo sauce, yummy! Tour of Italy also a good options, our daughter love it! The Shrimp Scampi was fresh and tasty. They also has chicken menu, we tried the pizza plus fries combo, the kids love it!

Appetizers came out quickly, the calamari was fresh and hot, and the salad was crisp and cool. When the food came out it was hot and fresh, the shrimp alfredo tasted exquisite and it was such a large portion ibwas able to take some home to enjoy it later.

The service is excellent! Our waiter Juan was the best! Just reserve 1 hr before closing time (1:30pm) to allow yourself to enjoy the meal. The open table app reserves the seating for them and was not accurate with the actual available seating times. So just check out their website hours before making your reservation online. Other than that, it is a great place to have an elegant experience!

Had lunch here with a friend. The service was excellent. The place has an interesting and attractive ambiance. Had a fresh-made lentil soup and my friend had a burger with some tasty fries. Both were tasty. Reasonably priced given how well everything was made.
Don’t let the fact that this is a hotel restaurant dissued you, it is very fresh and delicious. Here’s a breakfast sandwich I got with a hash brown side:

Really yummy food. Loved everything we ate here! All the food is fresh and the staff can be a little weird but they weren't rude so that's okay. Their all you can eat breakfast is the best with lots of options to choose from, the soups are hearty too. We weren't too impressed with the mushroom flat bread, it felt too dry. Apart from that, everything was great!

Wrong wine initially brought. Mushroom cake was not what was expected. Filet was cooked, brought back to life and then cooked again for medium request. Sides were forgotten. Wrong beverage poured into glass, twice.

It was my second visit to the Coastal Flat and I wasn’t disappointed.   The visit was many years ago and wasn’t memorable.  The bread basket was hot donuts which I always enjoyed at the Great American Restaurants chains.  We started off with baby crab slider.  While it was good, in my taste it was too  heavily seasoned.  I order Pecan crusted trout based on reviews here and I wasn’t disappointed. Shrimp with grit was very good except we found it a bit heavy.

Fantastic place for dinner! The atmosphere is welcoming, decor visually stimulating & service excellent! Their regular house salad is super healthy & tastes much better than the usual house salads at other restaurants. The tile & wall colors in the ladies' bathroom is such a unique color of blue & green hues! Very visually appealing!

Great atmosphere and great staff!! The food was phenomenal!! A nice cold beer to cleanse the palate! Choose the seafood or just the turf! Everything is great! The staff is very professional and have been highly trained to take great care of you! I highly recommend this place!! The food, the staff and the atmosphere are fantastic!!

Great and (relatively) healthy food at a surprisingly affordable price! If you’re already in the mall for shopping and want some place good to sit down and relax, Coastal Flats is definitely recommended. The beach thematic, the nice decoration, the relaxed ambiance and the tasty seafood are the key takeaways.

Everything is great here, but the “lavash” bread served with the special crab dip appetizer was super hard and crispy. Not a deal breaker but a little disappointing.

The salmon here is to die for. Smoky and spectacularly delicious. Think perfectly crispy bacon meets the best salmon. I’d stock my freezer with it if I could.

This chocolate mousse cake was perfect but that’s all we could do after such a great meal.

We've been going here for over 10 years and had not been since shortly before the pandemic so it was nice to revisit them.
We went to celebrate my in-laws' anniversary.
Some of the meats were a little under seasoned from what I remember and the first round of the beef rib was dry and one of the steaks but other than that, it's good. The mash potatoes are still great!
The house drink is a small power punch so thread lightly when ordering multiple ones!
Our bill was $374 for 4 rodizios, 5 cocktails, and 1 dessert.

One of the best Brazilian Steakhouses around. Came here with my family to celebrate my birthday and we had such a wonderful time and the dining experience was very good. So many different kinds meats brought to our table and cut right in front of you! Everything was great! Staff was friendly and made the dinner so enjoyable! Can’t wait to come back. Just wish it wasn’t so faraway, but definitely worth the drive! We made a day trip out of it and spent the afternoon at the National Zoo and then dinner here at Chima!

Very nice restaurant, warm and friendly servers, and plenty of great steaks and meats.
There is a good salad bar that has several options, a few are almost unique.
Some notes,
This is a steakhouse,  so obviously not a good idea for vegan lovers.
Parking is limited around the restaurant; however,   there is a garage parking very close by.
It would be better to reserve a table, Friday to Sunday, for sure.
Meats? Coming endless, beef, pork, and lamb, but limited options for shrimp and fish.
They also serve several type of bread, cheese, and sides.
Negative?
It's a bit expensive if you're in a tight budget , better do a math first.
For a family of 4, if you stick to water for your drink, and no dessert,  and not considering any tip, you end up more than 250$

A very good Brazilian steakhouse, but honestly a bit overpriced for the quality and service. I have seen better salad bar offerings, and the service seemed to lack some speed. It was a good experience, but I can enjoy a similar meal at a slightly less price.

Nice ambiance. Took a little while for us to be waited on but when we did, we had a great waitress. Very attentive. Food was delicious. My only complaint is when they come around with the meat, they need to slow it down some. Blood and sauce from the meat they cut was all over the table (white table cloths at that) due to them rushing. Other than that, I recommend this place.

Absolutely amazing food and service every single time. The bar staff and managers go above and beyond ti ensure both quality of food and service that is friendly and welcoming. I got the biggest lobster of my life here and it was prepared perfectly! It's my new local favorite. They even helped Max and Jamie, thank you so much for helping make sure I got my Laundry points logged! Love this place!

We set a reservation for a party of 6 and specifically asked for separate checks. The food itself was average, the steak was good, but the fries were badly made.  The steak tartare is not a steak tartare, but chunks of meat, good meat, but not in any sense a steak tartare.

Our waitress Monia was very good and professional. I can't say the same about the manager Nick.

As I said we had asked in the reservation separate checks, but the restaurant does not do that. They have a stupid policy about that according to the manager, even so when I asked for a solution he suggested that I could use the calculator on my cell phone, once this was our problem. What a shame for a manager.

For a restaurant that shows itself as a high end with a high price, it shows itself as a low quality management and hardly high end food.

My husband took me to the Palm for my birthday. We spent way too much money, but we don't regret it all for the experience! For an appetizer, the waitress recommended the shrimp bruno, which was pretty good but nothing too spectacular. The shrimp was lightly fried perfectly and had a light drizzle of sauce, but I wish there was more of that. They had a good selection of bourbon, considering it's slim pickings these days and the rosé by the glass was good. For dinner, I ordered the 3lb lobster with a crab stuffing. It was delicious and there was a lot of meat, but I couldn't finish it all. The only thing I didn't like was the amount of char on some parts of the lobster because the taste was pretty overpowering, but that was only on a few spots, so not worth complaining about. My husband ordered a steak and added a lobster tail, which was a pretty big tail. His steak was cooked how he requested, but he said it wasn't anything special and, unfortunately, he could probably get a better steak elsewhere for less money.. We also ordered the garlic mashed potatoes (yum) and black truffle gnocchi (double yum). The waitress gifted us a dessert for my birthday. We got the key lime pie with blueberry (delicious!)! If there's another time where we want to treat ourselves to a pricey dinner, we'd definitely consider the Palm.

So my wife and I visited The Palm for our anniversary. Needless to say for the money that I paid was disappointed. I will start with what was good. The complimentary valet parking, the jumbo shrimp cocktail and the raisin bread. Everything else was not worth the cost. The salad was just ok! The steak that I had was burnt on the top and my wife's steak which was supposed to be medium and looked less cooked than mine. The broccoli raab was not good at all. The 3 cheese potato au gratin was basically bland even though it was supposed to be 3 cheeses. The top it all off our waiter was let's say different. He actually reached across my wife's plate while she was eating to give her a soda and he actually came to our table an was coughing. I wish our experience was better. I expected that the food and service was going to be great but it was fair/poor!

I made a reservation for my girlfriend 21st birthday. When arrived i was greeted nicely with my guest but when seated we had a half drunken glass of wine sitting at the table and wasn't given the menu after 5 minutes or even asked for water. Later asked to move to a booth and was finally greeted after about 10 minutes by the server. I then ordered the tomahawk steak with a lobster tail but the steak was not even cooked just seared and was told the kitchen had closed. I felt uncomfortable with the service and steak. I was informed the chef was a bit mad because my steak was undercooked and i payed over $700 and was given this type of service and food .what a joke I'm highly disappointed

Consistently good food and classy service. Perfect for small plates as well as big steaks and tasty table sides. Our favorites are the French onion soup (nobody makes it better) and the truffle fries (well balanced taste and fried to perfection).
This time, close to Christmas there was a full house, but the staff took great care of us even when there was a delay in the kitchen. Always 100 percent satisfaction.

My husband and I celebrated our anniversary in Virginia and decided to come here. We were running late, and they gave us a courtesy call to hold our table. When we got there, the staff greeted us and congratulated us on our anniversary. They even decorated the table and gave us a card. We recieved complimentary passion fruit martinis that were delicious. Our waiter, Walter, was amazing. He took real good care of us even when it started getting busy. I loved the anniversary decorations for the desserts. The main course was cooked perfectly. Everything tasted so good. We will definitely come back.

Exceptional experience.  Service was amazing. I had steak (medium). It came out perfect the first time. Someone recommended calamari for appetizer so we had that. It was very delicious.  Best thing about the whole experience was the price.  We spent ~$100/person  for a great experience. I will definitely recommend the place and i will be revisiting soon.  There is a dress code btw.
5 star restaurant for sure.
Only thing I would note is the $5 valet. Not the money part ,but  I didn't have cash and had to put it on my corporate card.
The best surf and turf I've ever had! Lobster was amazing! Worth every penny. Great service too. Highly recommend for a date night or a work event.

Highly recommend!

I had the pleasure of recently visiting the Capital Grille restaurant, and I can confidently confirm that it truly is an outstanding steakhouse experience! The service was impeccable - the servers were incredibly attentive and knowledgeable, the bar tenders were fantastic and the managers were always present to ensure that our dining experience was running smoothly. The atmosphere in the restaurant is cozy and inviting - it has such a nice ambiance! And of course, the food was absolutely delicious. My particular favorite was the bone in filet - it isn't even on the menu, so you have to mention it to your server in order to get it, but I can assure you that it is well worth it! I would absolutely recommend visiting the Capital Grille for an enjoyable steakhouse experience. I will definitely be returning for many more special occasions!

I have always enjoyed eating at Panera Bread; I love this chain and highly recommend it. Almost every location I went to was spacious, had enough seating and tables, clean bathrooms, tidy and polished food-handlers, reasonable prices, fresh bakery, high quality salads, sandwiches, coffee and generous portions.
Panera is a great spot for getting either healthy food or downright bread. Very relaxed atmosphere and good food. Service is always good and food is always delivered fast.

This location is pretty big with both indoor and outdoor seating. I had to get my car serviced and needed to kill sometime so came here. Very clean, very friendly and helpful staff. If you haven’t really had this egg white spinach sandwich yet, you are missing out on deliciousness.

This was a good restaurant, but lately they are not doing a good gob, I ordered this morning 2 greek yogurt parfait and both of them were really messy they were sticky from outside because they put a lot of honey in there, I could say that there was more honey than yogurt on it, I had to trhow it away because I was in my way to work, it was really a bad experience, the las time was almost the same I ordered a yogurt parfait and they gave me just the yogurt with no fruit no granola in it, how am i supose to eat just the yogurt? And I payed almost $5 for it.  I have to mention that all my orders were online for pick it up.

We enjoyed using our Panera Bread gift cards this morning.  This restaurant location was about one mile from our lodging, so it was very convenient to find it.  The order taker was very friendly.  They were out of my preference, my second menu choice tasted great!  It’s good that social distancing and mask wearing are practiced here!

Went to Nostos recently after seeing reviews and found it on the best restaurant list. The dinner was awesome. We had a great time. We had swordfish, octopus and for entree we shared rockfish and mini kebab. Definitely worth to try especially when you are already shopping at Tyson Corner :).

I would not recommend this restaurant. The prices were high and the food was just okay.

The dishes were overly salty and oily, making it difficult to enjoy the meal. The service was also poor, as I had to constantly ask for water refills to try and counter the saltiness of the food. It seemed like the only focus of the restaurant was using salt and oil to create a fancy dish, rather than actually making good food.

Overall, it was a disappointing experience and I would not return. There are much better Greek restaurants out there that offer better quality food and service.

Attentive service, great lunch/dinner spot! Octopus and the crispy zucchini were so good! The dessert I picked was also delish - all of them actually were! It is a bit on the steep side but it is worth it for the quality of food. Reservation is recommended because it fills up quickly!

We decided to try this wonderful Greek restaurant and can't wait to go back!  Even later in the night it was still a very busy place and with the quality of food and service, I can certainly see why!  I'll have to get more photos of the delicious food next time.  I was only able to get our appetizers:  the TZATZIKI and the FETA SAGANAKI.  Definitely try those!  Hubby doesn't like Sesame oil or seeds too much but I convinced him to try it....he couldn't stop eating it!  It was that good!

The food and vibe were both elegantly traditional and modern at the same time.  Fresh ingredients and wonderfully prepared, a justifiably popular place with a friendly atmosphere and excellent service.

Visited BJs in October 2022 - read the pizza put them on the map so naturally had to try it out since we love deep dish pizza. We were definitely not disappointed but just a note to pizza lovers - if you like A LOT of toppings ask for a few extra minutes cook time since the pans are deep and a lot of Ingredients will affect cook time. Overall experience was pleasant - but don’t bother with the queso dip (it’s not hot) and not special about it. We had a flight of beer which was better than ordering and committing to full glasses IF you prefer tasting a little bit of everything. Ambiance was good and not overly noisy, restaurant has high ceilings and a pretty bar with lots of TVs - decent little spot.

We ordered deep dish pizza plus drinks. Pizza was half cooked & not fully baked not with full toppings as ordered, which gave upset stomachache.  Moscow mule was watery, not mixed well and had no mint.  Old fashioned was horrible as well.. water with whiskey with a slice of orange.
Very disappointed

Great Friday night dinner! First time at BJ's in Tysons. Dinner was delicious... queso dip for an app, Prime Rib, and the Enlightened Pacific Poke Soba Noodles for our entrée. Exceptional service.. Sarah P did a great job.

My husband and I decide to go out to eat since we haven’t gone out in awhile and we had the worst experience here surprisingly this is my husband favorite place. Our order took a while it’s been 2hrs we still haven’t received our dessert and our drink came after we were almost done with our one appetizer and main course. I’m assuming is short staff in the kitchen. Was not pleased with my nachos not having chicken like I ordered.

This is a nice location. They have good specials during the game. The Oktoberfest beer was great. Chips and salsa, queso, or guacamole are only $3 during happy hour. I would definitely recommend this place.

It is an experience and a whole vibe. Professional and classy without being stuffy. The service from Kendra was outstanding. The food was fresh and flavorful. Had the Lobster bisque, caesar salad, and the Tomahawk with creamed spinach and Asparagus as sides. I've never tasted creamed spinach as good as that. I'm not a wine drinker, but one of my dining companions enjoyed both the white (a reisling, I believe) and the red she had with her steak.

Everything was divine. Outstanding service and food is 👌🏾 👏🏾 👍🏽 🙌🏾 😋. Well seasoned and cooked perfectly. Nothing bad about our experience. Parking was a little bit strange but now we know what to expect because it is right under/near a few hotels. They even include a 3 course kids menu with nice options.

Went there to celebrate a birthday. Ambiance was excellent.  Appetizers had a little less salt than we usually like but it was fresh and delicious.  Aged steak was perfect.  I asked specially to top it off with grilled mushrooms and grilled onions just how I like it.  I have been there before , they're consistently excellent.

Took my wife here for her Birthday dinner and had a wonderful experience.  Our server Kendra was phenomenal and the food was on point.  The bone-in ribeye was perfection along with the Fleming's Potatoes.  From the bread and butter to their wine selection, Fleming's delivered the best dining experience I've had in years.  Cheers!

We went there on Tomahawk Tuesday to celebrate a family event.  The online reservation system allowed me to make a little arrangement for the occasion.  That's a nice touch on top of high-quality steak and side dishes.

This is an experience not a shopping trip. It is a world-class tourist destination in fact! The displays are incredible, the staff is engaged, knowledgeable and helpful, and we have spent hours here without getting bored. Honestly I think we could spend all day. The bistro is incredible and they offer events. My daughter took a hair styling class, which was very reasonably priced and small class sizes, plus she got adorable things to take home including a salon apron and stylist belt, a brush, and an adorable pretend acrylic balloon.

Every once in awhile we also schedule Samantha to have her hair done- what they can do is phenomenal. It always looks like she has brand new hair - she was made in 1992! The salon prices are great. Samantha had her ears pierced last year for only $6 and received 4 pairs of earrings on top!

Beautiful Doll, Same Name as my Daughter

I purchased this doll not only because it is the first Chinese-American Girl of the Year, but also because she has the same name as my daughter! She was so excited to see a doll that looks like her at the store and even shares the same name! Thank you American Girl for representing Asian-Americans especially in this current social climate. Positive representation and inclusion of Asian-Americans is so important. Our Chinese-American family appreciates this very much, and my Corinne loves her new beautiful doll! Best toy purchase we have ever made. Will purchase more from American Girl in the future.

It was a beautiful store with lots of experiences.  My daughter was looking for a particular doll that was on backorder.  They were able to have it shipped right to our house quicker than anticipated thanks to the salesperson.  She was super helpful!

This is girl heaven! I grew up reading the American girl dolls and the was excited to share them with my daughter. We have been reading the books for a couple years now and we even did an American girl party for her 5th birthday.

He finally were able to travel to a city where they had an American girl store and we did all of the things.

Started with the salon where our American girl doll got her nails painted ears, pierced and her hair done.

Then spend some time shopping around the store and taking fun pictures and looking at all the cool options that are available for American girl dolls of all generations.

Then we have lunch in the bistro which is really fun experience which includes a special seat for your doll (But there are options if you don't have it all yet) and then you get to have delicious kid style finger foods that are enjoyable for adults too.

Definitely get the pink lemonade and the standard three part meal.

Overall, this was an awesome experience with an incredibly helpful staff that really truly loves what they do and loves creating memorable experiences for the girls that come in. Special heads up to the mother-daughter manager salon team for being so accommodating and helpful and kind.

My daughter 10th birthday was  ruin. The party was scheduled for March 12, 2022 at 3:15 . We arrived at the store at 2pm early with the girls . We took pictures and I bought 3 dolls.  The store ran out of food . After two hours and multiple changes to food order because they did not have it. After 2 hours of waiting we never got our food and was given a partially frozen birthday cake with no ice cream . The cake icing came completely off the cake when cutting into it because it was still some what frozen. My sister had to light the cake because server didn’t have a lighter that work. The birthday girl very was disappointed. The worst experience ever for a party . I had to take a party of 8 to Fridays in the Mall to eat .

name: California Pizza Kitchen at Tysons Corner

reviews.text:
Julie was outstanding and helped us with menu selection followed by dessert 🍨

Food was tasty 😋 kids doubled up on the pizza for seconds..

Wait time was 5 minutes and were seated pretty quickly. Highly recommend this place for a good family or solo time. Try out their lunch specials that run till 4 PM daily.

🤩🤩🤩🤩🤩

Food is good, but the customer care is pathetic! One person attended our table to take order, after that whenever we ask him, he just ignores us for subsequent order and handed our table to different person. I will NOT visit this CPK ever again!

It was our first time here and we give it 2 stars. The food was an actual 3/5 it could have been tastier, but we enjoyed the bread and the pizza. The corn was a major let down as it was plated in a bowl. The customer service was the actual let down, the hostess was rude, messy, and wasn’t sitting people according to the wait list.

I probably would be looking for a better pizza joint next time.

The gluten free pizza was good, and they say  precautions are taken to avoid cross contamination.  The crust is a cauliflower thin crust that was decent in texture and taste, with no odd aftertaste.  The toppings were good.  I would eat there again.
Great service and food, if you are here you should must try Buffalo Cauliflower, Street Corn, and Tostada Pizza.

* Love the bread there.

* Try the lentil soup. It's really good.

* The Taboulah salad and the garlic sauce tastes just like homemade (positive), simply perfect compared to other restaurants.

* The meat and the chicken are dry almost most of the time.

* Service is OK slow at times.

* The cleanliness level is good.

* outside and inside seating area

* Parking available.

Beautiful ambience and incredible staff. The server was friendly, made amazing suggestions and went out of the way to get us comfortable. The food was fantastic - the eggplant Fatteh was delicious - creamy and fresh. The mezze sampler was a delight and was a very generous portion (for 6 of us!)

Also loved the baklava and pistachio ice cream and the roasted cauliflower.

Pretty good restaurant. My favorite part is the hot, fresh bread they bring to the table to go with the babaganush (costs extra). This time I ordered the shawarma platter. I should have just went with the sandwich. I prefer how the flavors mix together in the sandwich rather than the rice that comes with the platter. My wife ordered the falafel sandwich. She really enjoyed it. Our server, Anton, was great.

A really great place to have Mediterranean food!

My husband and I went to this place for lunch on a weekend, the ambience, the food and drinks were great!!

We ordered a pomenade and mint tea for drinks, decently priced and great flavor.
For appetizer we got the Hummus Trio, it sufficient for two people. TASTES YUMMMM!!! A must try
For entre we got the Lamb kabob, great quantity and taste!

Loved this place, will definitely visit again!!!

It was my first time here and my experience was amazing. The food was really good and the fries were hot and fresh.

edit
I just saw a review of someone saying they saw a rat which is a little concerning so I might not come back again..

Absolutely incredible experience!

All plates were large, full of flavor and unique. It was amazing to see how many vegan options they had as well.

The highlight were the protein pancakes. Oatmeal, blueberry pancakes with 40g of protein!!! Incredible

Absolutely recommend this place

Found this gem walking near our hotel.  Excellent food, with loads of creative options.  We had the Red, white and blue stuffed French toast, Belgium waffles with eggs.  The bacon was excellent and I recommend tying the chicken sausage. Very busy place with loads of seating.  It's located near Tysons Center mall. We liked it so much, we came back the next day and recommended it to a few family members.  Food is locally sourced.

Wife and I stopped for brunch.  We both had the apple stuff French toast.  It good……but extremely sweet.  If you can’t eat real sweet things don’t order.  I love breakfast and I love  my syrup.  However, even for me they were to much.  The order brings two and my wife only managed to barely eat one.  The services was great!  Our server Sandya kept my coffee filled and graciously appeared often to see if we needed anything.

This is the second Silver Diner that I have been to and hands down this location has excellent customer service. We got our milkshakes and appetizers way before our entrees arrived.

I ordered a triple pickled chicken burger with sweet potato fries (extra dollar for the sweet potato fries). It looked just as pictured on the menu with two pieces of fried chicken cutlet. Everything was hot and delicious!! Highly recommend the triple pickled chicken burger if you love pickles.

This location is a 2-3 minute drive from Tyson Center Mall and there is parking on site.

This was an awesome place! We came here for breakfast and was delicious!  Our server was on top.of everything making sure we were satisfied with our meal, juices, and coffee.  The atmosphere was superb making it feel like a typical 1950's style diner similar to the setting of the diner in the movie Back to the Future.  I love the old school jukebox and having the mini one at the table, really cool!

Very nice restaurant. Great atmosphere. Nice location in the mall. Bathroom was clean. Out of paper towels though. I ordered the salmon with creamed spinach. Very good. Also had some corn bread with some corn in it. It was pretty good. I also ordered the shrimp and crab bisque. It was delicious. Menu had varieties. Recommend and will definitely come back.

I must say the food was exceptional. Everything was fresh and hot. The atmosphere was wonderful. Everything was great. It was my first time there. The waiter was very tentative. Even though it he had a lot of tables to wait on. Another place to go with your special or significant other.

Our birthday celebration started off to a rocky start but nevertheless Sandra and Stephen turned our frowns upside down. Main things that stood out were the amazing cornbread (with actual corn in it!) and I enjoyed 2 rounds of the lovely mimosa flights (featured in photo). Food was good, good service (thx Stephen), & attentive management. Great dining experience overall!

Wild Fire is delicious. My 2nd time going didn't disappoint. We were in a private room with very attentive servers. The chop salad was very tasty despite the blue cheese (I hate blue cheese). The salmon on the cedar plank was delicious. The cocktails were amazing.

I’ve been coming here for years, the steak and service has never disappointed. The steak is juicy, tender and loaded with flavor. The  service is always  great, the waiter knew the menu, and was very attentive. One of my favorite steakhouse.
